titles.en: Chapter 168 – The walking briskly in the valley of Muhassar

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ جَهِلَ أَنْ يَقِفَ بِالْمَشْعَرِ
titles.en: Chapter 169 – The one who is ignorant that he should be pausing at the Monuments

titles.ar: بَابُ لَيْلَةِ الْمُزْدَلِفَةِ وَ الْوُقُوفِ بِالْمَشْعَرِ وَ الْإِفَاضَةِ مِنْهُ وَ حُدُودِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 167 – The night of Al-Muzdalifa, and the pausing at the (Sacred) Monuments and the departure from it, and its boundary
Chapter 168 – The walking briskly in the valley of Muhassar

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/130)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَفْصِ بْنِ الْبَخْتَرِيِّ وَ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّ

text: هُ قَالَ لِبَعْضِ وُلْدِهِ هَلْ سَعَيْتَ فِي وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ فَقَالَ لَا قَالَ فَأَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَرْجِعَ حَتَّى يَسْعَى قَالَ فَقَالَ لَهُ ابْنُهُ لَا أَعْرِفُهُ فَقَالَ لَهُ سَلِ النَّاسَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hafs Bin Al Bakhtary, and someone else,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said to one of his<sup>asws</sup> sons: ‘Did you walk briskly in the valley of Muhassar?’ So he said, ‘No’. So he<sup>asws</sup> ordered him that he should return until he walks briskly. So his<sup>asws</sup> son said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I do not recognise it’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘Ask the people’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hafs ibn af-Bakhtariy and others who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, once asked one of his sons, ’Did you do Sa‘y (running slowly) in Wadiy Muhassar?’ He replied, ‘No, I did not do so.’ He (the Imam) commanded him to go back to perform Sa‘y (running slowly). His son said, ‘I do not know how to do it.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Ask the people how to do it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/131)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَجَّالِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا قَالَ

text: مَرَّ رَجُلٌ بِوَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ فَأَمَرَهُ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) بَعْدَ الِانْصِرَافِ إِلَى مَكَّةَ أَنْ يَرْجِعَ فَيَسْعَى .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hajjal, from one of our companions who said,
‘A man passed by the valley of Muhassar, so Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> ordered him, after his leaving to go to Makkah, that he should return, and he should walk briskly’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hajjal from certain persons of our people who has said the following: “A man passed by Wadiy Muhassar and abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, after his arriving in Makkah commanded him to go back to perform Sa‘y (running slowly).”’ (Fatwa best explains Hadith 1-2 of this Chapter)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/131)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ وَ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا مَرَرْتَ بِوَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ وَ هُوَ وَادٍ عَظِيمٌ بَيْنَ جَمْعٍ وَ مِنًى وَ هُوَ إِلَى مِنًى أَقْرَبُ فَاسْعَ فِيهِ حَتَّى تُجَاوِزَهُ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) حَرَّكَ نَاقَتَهُ وَ قَالَ اللَّهُمَّ سَلِّمْ لِي عَهْدِي وَ اقْبَلْ تَوْبَتِي وَ أَجِبْ دَعْوَتِي وَ اخْلُفْنِي فِيمَنْ تَرَكْتُ بَعْدِي .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, and Safwan Bin Yahya, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When you pass by the valley of Muhassar, and it is a great valley between Jam’a and Mina, and it is nearer to Mina, so walk briskly in it until you exceed it, for Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> stirred on his<sup>saww</sup> she-camel and said: ‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Secure my<sup>saww</sup> Covenant for me<sup>saww</sup>, and Accept my<sup>saww</sup> repentance, and Answer my<sup>saww</sup> call, and be in my<sup>saww</sup> place among the ones whom I<sup>saww</sup> leave behind’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Muhammad ibn Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from ibn abu ‘Umayr and Safwan ibn Yahya from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that when passing through the valley of Muhassar, which is a vast valley between Mina and Jam‘, a little nearer to Mina, walk faster until you pass it. The Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, stirred his camel and said, ‘O Allah, keep my promise safe, accept my repentance, answer my prayer and be my deputy among those whom I have left behind.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/131)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: الْحَرَكَةُ فِي وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ مِائَةُ خُطْوَةٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Muhammad Bin Ismail,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The moving (briskly) in the valley of Muhassar is of one hundred steps’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Muhammad ibn ‘Isma‘il who has said the following: “Abu al-Hassan ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Moving in Wadiy Muhassar is for one hundred steps.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/131)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ حَدِّ جَمْعٍ قَالَ مَا بَيْنَ الْمَأْزِمَيْنِ إِلَى وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Is’haq Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the boundary of Jam’a. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘What is between the two narrow points up to the valley of Muhassar’.
en.sarwar: 5. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the boundaries of Jam‘. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is between al-Mazemin to Wadiy Muhassar.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/131)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى وَ غَيْرُهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: حَدُّ الْمُزْدَلِفَةِ مِنْ مُحَسِّرٍ إِلَى الْمَأْزِمَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya and someone else, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Ali Bin Al Numan, from Abdullah Bin Muskan, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A boundary of Al-Muzdalifa is from Muhassar up to the two narrow points’.
en.sarwar: 6. Muhammad ibn Yahya and others have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isma‘il from Ali ibn al-Nu’man ‘Abd Allah ibn Muskan forms who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘The boundaries of al-Muzdalifah are from Muhassar to al-Mazemin.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/132)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ وَ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِذَا كَثُرَ النَّاسُ بِجَمْعٍ وَ ضَاقَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُونَ قَالَ يَرْتَفِعُونَ إِلَى الْمَأْزِمَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, and a number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, altogether from Ibn Abu Nasr, from Sama’at who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘When the people are numerous at Jam’a and there is narrowness upon them, what should they be doing?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They should be arising to go to the two narrow points’.
en.sarwar: 7. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn and a number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad all from ibn abu Basir from Sanaa ‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘What happens if Jam‘ cannot accommodate all people?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘They can go higher to al-Mazemin.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/132)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ الْعَاصِمِيُّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ التَّيْمُلِيِّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عُثْمَانَ الْأَزْدِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُذَافِرٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ

text: الرَّمَلُ فِي وَادِي مُحَسِّرٍ قَدْرُ مِائَةِ ذِرَاعٍ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad Al Aasimy, from Ali Bin Al Hassan Al Taymuly, from Amro Bin Usman Al Azdy, from Muhammad Bin Uzafir, from Umar Bin Yazeed,
He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The brisk walking in the valley of Muhassar is of a measurement of one hundred cubits’.
en.sarwar: 8. Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-’Asemiy has narrated from Ali ibn al-Husayn al-Taymuliy from ‘Amr ibn ‘Uthman al-Azdiy from Muhammad ibn ‘Adhafir from ‘Umar ibn Yazid who has said the following: “The distance to perform Sa‘y (running slowly) in Wadiy Muhassar is of one hundred yards.’”
